attributes.action: Do not scrap the reform of the Gender Recognition Act - Save trans lives UK
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, people have to ‘prove’ their gender by handing in a series of documents, including the aforementioned medical diagnosis of gender dysphoria reviewed by a panel that will not meet the applicant.
This should not be needed under the reform. The Equality Act has ‘safeguards’ to protect single-sex spaces for women however this will exclude transgender people from single-sex spaces like bathrooms and locker rooms, and services they require access to, such as refuges and homeless shelters.
attributes.background:
The government is reportedly planning to scrap the reform of the Gender Recognition Act. The reform sought to change a lengthy, bureaucratic and expensive process where you required a medical diagnosis to change the gender listed on your birth certificate.
This reform is needed now more than ever.

rejection.details:
